item.title: How to set up python on your computer
item.description: There are many ways to install Python. You can ask three people about this topic and you will get five different opinions. My opinionated recommendation is to use pyenv. pyenv Link to heading To install it, we use brew: brew update brew install pyenv pyenv-virtualenv Then, we append these lines at the end of the ~/.zshrc file: # pyenv config export PYENV_ROOT="$HOME/.pyenv" command -v pyenv >/dev/null || export PATH="$PYENV_ROOT/bin:$PATH" eval "$(pyenv init -)" eval "$(pyenv virtualenv-init -)" pyenv-virtualenv
